Dear Zesty (Meghan) ,

I don't even know where to begin expressing the depth of my love for you. From the moment I met you, I knew that you were the one for me. You light up my world with your smile and your infectious laugh. I cannot imagine a single day without you in my life.

Your beauty, both inside and out, captivates me every single day. Your kind heart, your unwavering support, and your unconditional love make me feel like the luckiest person in the world. Every time I look into your eyes, I am reminded of the incredible love that we share and I feel a sense of peace and happiness that I never knew existed.

I am grateful for every moment that we have shared together. From our first date to the adventures we have had, every moment with you is a treasure that I will cherish forever. You have taught me so much about love, patience, and kindness, and I felt like a better person for having you in my life.

As I write this letter,  I am  grateful  for the amazing woman that you are. I promise to always be there for you, to support you, and to love you. You are my soulmate, my best friend, and my true love. 

I will always remember the times we spent playing Red Dead Online together and created all those wonderful memories from the drinking at the moonshine bar and dancing and laughing and slapping each other around till we ended up falling on the floor.  Flying off our horses and doing wild stuff with matching outfits and looking badass as hell. I'll never be able to experience this game the same without you 💔 .  I love you....

Forever and always,
Crossxfires  (Jason)

People really need to give this game a chance. Most GTA fanboys say Red Dead Online is bad until they actually play it. Every one of my friends who I have gotten to hop on RDO simply can't get enough of it. To this day I still believe that this is the most immersive and breath-taking open world game you can buy. I have over 100 days played combined X Box and PC and still sometimes stumble across hidden gems in the open world. However, the game isn't perfect as there are many bugs, and a sub par amount of content for higher rank players. Not to mention, Rockstar hasn't released a major update for this game in over a year. It is sad that such a good game has been neglected for so long as I believe it has a TON of potential. I still continue to recommend this game as it offers an unmatched experience for new players, and maybe one day Rockstar will see this games potential and save Red Dead Online.

Red Dead Redemption 2 - A Masterpiece of Wild West Immersion

Red Dead Redemption 2, developed and published by Rockstar Games, is a sprawling open-world action-adventure game set in the late 1800s, during the declining years of the Wild West era. Released in 2018 for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and later for PC, Red Dead Redemption 2 quickly garnered critical acclaim for its breathtaking graphics, engaging gameplay, and captivating story. As a prequel to the original Red Dead Redemption game, Red Dead Redemption 2 provides players with an immersive experience as they step into the boots of Arthur Morgan, a member of the infamous Van der Linde gang. With its meticulous attention to detail, deep character development, and vast open world to explore, Red Dead Redemption 2 is nothing short of a masterpiece.

One of the first things that stands out in Red Dead Redemption 2 is its stunning visual design. The game features a meticulously crafted open world that is vast, diverse, and teeming with life. From the lush forests of New Hanover to the arid deserts of New Austin, each region of the game world feels distinct and has its own unique beauty. The attention to detail is astonishing, with dynamic weather patterns, realistic animal behavior, and stunning vistas that make the world come alive. Whether it's watching a sunset over the plains or seeing the snow crunch under Arthur's boots as he trudges through a blizzard in the mountains, the visual fidelity of Red Dead Redemption 2 is nothing short of breathtaking.

The gameplay in Red Dead Redemption 2 is equally impressive. As Arthur Morgan, players will engage in a wide range of activities, including hunting, fishing, horseback riding, robbing trains, and engaging in epic gunfights. The controls are intuitive and responsive, allowing players to easily navigate the game world and engage in various activities. The combat system is well-designed, with a mix of shooting and cover mechanics that make gunfights intense and satisfying. Players can also interact with the world around them, from talking to NPCs and engaging in meaningful conversations to making decisions that impact the story and gameplay.

One of the standout features of Red Dead Redemption 2 is its deep and complex characters. Arthur Morgan is a flawed protagonist who is torn between his loyalty to the Van der Linde gang and his own moral compass. As players progress through the game, they will witness Arthur's character arc, as he grapples with his past, makes difficult choices, and comes to terms with his own morality. The supporting cast of characters is equally compelling, with each member of the Van der Linde gang having their own unique personalities, motivations, and relationships with Arthur. The writing is top-notch, with well-written dialogue and memorable interactions that draw players into the story and create a deep emotional connection with the characters.

The story in Red Dead Redemption 2 is epic and engrossing. The game's narrative spans across several years and is filled with twists, turns, and moments of both triumph and tragedy. As Arthur Morgan, players will experience a richly crafted story that delves into the complexities of loyalty, family, and the pursuit of the American Dream. The game explores themes of morality, civilization versus the wild, and the changing landscape of the West as it transitions from an untamed frontier to a modern society. The writing is superb, with well-defined characters, meaningful dialogue, and a sense of authenticity that draws players into the world of the game.

In addition to its engaging story and characters, Red Dead Redemption 2 offers a vast open world to explore. The game world is filled with a staggering amount of detail, from the bustling towns and cities to the serene countryside and remote wilderness areas. Players can embark on various activities such as hunting

This comes from somebody with over 2000 hours of online experience. Most of my hours are from the Red Dead Redemption 2 game on my profile.

While great at first, Red Dead Online’s ongoing support has been declining. There used to be weekly updates that brought new content to the game, and when was the last time we had any content updates? Last June, and it was a minor update, feeling like a filler update leaving us hoping for something much bigger. When was the last major update that added a new role which offered a completely new way to play? Nearly two years ago, July 2020. Where's our ever-evolving world we were promised?

One of the game’s major issues additionally worth pointing out because it ultimately hurts the game’s experience is cheaters and hackers. They comprise of about half the players you will see. If you are looking for PvP, this is not the game for you, at least on PC. The gunplay is amazing, but cheaters ruined it and it is now, and has been for the longest time, heavily discouraged in wanting to engage in any form of PvP. You may shoot somebody, only to wonder why they don’t lose health, you keep shooting them over and over again, and they never die, even from one-shot kill headshots. Then the next thing you know, many of them further ruin your gameplay experience by deciding they want to “fight back” with their cheats and spawn a cage on you, or even spawning explosions on your feet constantly, killing you over and over until you switch sessions, or even straight up crashing your game. Ironically, these are the reasons it is more fun to play this online multiplayer game by yourself. True solo content is offered, but you have to look for it.

While it may be a fun new game for newer players, this is one of Rockstar Games’ examples that have hurt hopes for their games’ longevities for us more veteran players. Yes, the Red Dead Online title has much to offer, where I would guarantee a few month’s worth of playtime, but there is generally not much reason to come back afterwards.

My ultimate verdict: beautiful game with lots of potential and a bit of replayability, and maybe I’ll admit, some grind, but we know Rockstar Games won’t put out content anytime soon. They also will refuse to address any cheating problems. They will do nothing about your reports, even with video evidence. Great game, poor support. 5/10

2023 now and no hope the game is getting saved. Thanks Rockstar.

I am about 50%/50% on this one.
From one side the character creation, world, mechanics and roles are pretty good.
From the other side, the game is dead and doesn't have anyone playing it (as far as i've seen in connected players menu), why?
Because the game doesn't get any updates and people get sick of the same content that isn't changing, rockstar abandoned such a good game, and i don't know why they have broke up the whole project while keeping on updating and giving flying cars for tryhards in GTA V online.
Let's be real, some people want the grind and to play missions without having the same experience, even tho I am more connected to the free roam itself, I want other people to enjoy too.
Even with that, if you have friends to play with this game is 100% RECOMMENDED.

SUMMARY (less details): The Mechanics and roles are good, the game has no players and gets no updates.
If you are the type of players who just like to free roam or to play with friends it is 100% RECOMMENDED.

NOTE: Sometimes you will find a cheater or 2 (or more) due to rockstar not giving sh*t on anticheat.

- It has a lot of modders (hackers/cheater) that grief you with cheats
- It is mostly abandoned by rockstar

Abandoned by rockstar is the only thing that truly stops this game from being of the greatest multiplayer games of all time. It is a awesome game. I love the environment and the realistic feel to the scenes. Amazing lighting and also the game play is fun. Really enjoy the old er, Riding horses and working your way up. I will tell you this if you haven't tried it you are missing out on a great experience.

I have played an additional 100+ hours after writing the review below. Pretty fun once you get settled in with rational controls and get past the fact that your party members won't get rewarded. Let's see how round 2 goes!This online experience is a watered down experience compared to the single player game. The keymappings for PC are poorly done and in in the intro it keeps trying to tell you to use left mouse button to mount your horse... too bad you need to hit E. That one experience explains 90% of the interactions for this game. Normal things are janky, your horse dies if you step on the wrong shadow, find and meeting up with friends is a nightmare. Just like the janky horses who die at the slightest breeze this "online" version of RD2 should be put out of its misery.Still not that fun after roughly another dozen hours. I like the music, the visuals are stunning, but the content is fairly light weight and boring after a while. Some of the more high level bounties with stories are actually pretty fun.Adding some more updates after ~90 hours of gameplay. Most fun professions from best to worst: 1. Moonshiner ~ kudos to this team. The story mission are fantastic and the level of difficulty makes it quality2. Bounty Hunter ~ legendary missions are pretty fun, but the game breaking bug where posse members don't get rewards can fuck right off... fix. this. shit. seriously3. Trader - doing the "long" deliveries and having Players interact have been some of my favorite moments of this game =D Exactly the type of thing I want from online old west. 4.  Naturalist - until you hit rank 5 you have to chase non large critters around with a varmet gun shooting them over and over again with ineffective drugged shots. Boring. After rank 5 legendary hunts are pretty fun but repetative. 5. Collector - GuhhhhhhhStill don't recommend it due to the game breaking posse issue where not all members get rewards (exp/gold/RDO$). The deves should play coop for a while and track the rewards for non posse leaders the issue would stand out immediately. The worst part is people payed really $$$ for some of the content assuming they didn't farm in-game gold to buy the professions.

This is an amazing game - ruined by hackers.   If you are playing with friends I recommend setting up your own private server, this will miss some of the interactions with other players and some of the PvP fun, but its so much better than putting up with the hackers.  Over 200 hours now on a private server with no FFFFFF8 crashes.  Before this on a public server every couple of hours it happened.

The landscapes are amazing, the weather effects are impressive, and the sounds are great - they have really nailed the sound of different horses, at different speeds, on different surfaces.   Animal A.I is good, getting chased by wolves, ride past some deer to distract them.   There is even humor to be found in the game - with possums playing possum.   Trader role is great for making money, the moonshiner storyline was good, and the different missions add good flavour to the role.  Naturalist is so slow to level, especially if you want to trade occassionally for $.

Red Dead Online is the multiplayer component of the critically acclaimed open-world game, Red Dead Redemption 2.

The game's graphics are stunning, with highly detailed environments and character models that bring the game's version of the American West to life. The game's sound design is also excellent, with a variety of ambient sounds that add to the immersive experience.

The gameplay is where Red Dead Online truly shines, with a variety of missions and activities to complete. Players can team up with friends to complete story missions or take part in a variety of side activities, such as hunting, fishing, and gambling.

One of the standout features of the game is its open-world design, which allows players to explore the vast and diverse landscape of the Wild West. Players can encounter other players in the world, leading to spontaneous and often unpredictable interactions.

The game's character creation system is also impressive, allowing players to customize their own unique characters and develop them over time through experience and equipment upgrades.

The game's multiplayer modes are well-designed, with a variety of competitive and cooperative modes to choose from. The game also features an honor system, which rewards players for honorable actions and punishes them for dishonorable ones.

Overall, Red Dead Online is an excellent multiplayer experience that offers a deep and immersive Wild West world for players to explore. With its stunning graphics, engaging gameplay. Sadly Rockstar doesn't care about this game so the updates are not coming out. But I would still say that it is a must-play for any fan of the open-world and multiplayer genres.

Alright, so I originally got the base game on console.
Beat it, loved it, kept playing it.
Online was released, and I played that with a friend up until rank 15, due to console players being extremely toxic. We couldn't find peace and enjoy the game.
Recently, I got online on steam, so I could enjoy it with the same friend, who explained that toxic players on pc are lacking.
They were right for the most part.
    Don't get me wrong, this game is incredible.
This game is beautiful.
But this game has problems.

Online is littered with hackers, who spawn cougars and other dangerous animals on top of you. They put explosives on your head, teleport you around, and overall just destroy the game experience.
Changing servers won't even work anymore with how common they are in the game, and with 181 hours on record, it's sad, because I haven't played as long as most people and I've seen more than enough to decide my review on the game.
You can report for disruptive behavior, which includes griefing, but nothing will be done.

Rockstar doesn't care about RD Online.
Rockstar doesn't care about their community.
Rockstar doesn't care to use the money they get from said community, to improve the game and anti-cheat system that they could add.

Online gets so few updates that are worthwhile, and it's tiresome seeing a game with so much potential and people playing it staying in the gutters.
    Until the hacking is fixed, and only until then, this game will keep this downgrade of a review from me.

Rockstar doesn't care.

|| EDIT ||

477 hours now, in hopes that the game would be fixed and updated.
Rockstar abandoned red dead online fully.
There's a horrid stable glitch, and while they announced that they weren't going to update the game anymore, the least they could do is fix the fucking glitches for what players they have that are staying loyal to this game.
Reinstalled it of hopes of nostalgia just to be left extremely disappointed and annoyed.
Want to play this game?
Don't.
Do the story mode instead, because they don't care enough to do anything with online, and the base game is better.
Pretty game but there is absolutely nothing to do, but enjoy the scenery and getting killed by griefers or running into the mandatory hacker

Update: I've played this game indepth and I still think my original review stands. This game feels unfinished in all honesty. Alot of glitches and bugs are easily fixable but have not been the past 4 years its been released, and the amount of hacking and greifing, and harassment going on in game is also an easy manage but has not been fixed in the past 4 years.

The plotline is simple and basic, which would be fine if there were more than 9 episode to it. Its so easy to blow through all the missions, especially when a posse member is a higher level then you. Theirs no real goal to gaining exp or upgrading or levelling up after the nine episode plotline as side missions never change and are the same basic bullshit over and over again with minimum reward, it starts to get so tedious.

Why am I sticking around? Why am I still playing this game and grinding ? If I cant use my weaponry or horses ive been working hard to level up for and unlock in anything new, then whats the damn point of playing this game? You could do all 9 episodes in less than two hours of buying this game. Its not worth 30$ and in fact with all the glitches and bugs id say its barely worth 15$.

The thing is though: This game is gorgeous. The graphics and animations are fantastic. The missions are fun the first few times around, and I like that they give quite a few customisation options to you, your equipment and your horse. I like that their is certain classes so to speak you can join aswell. Its unique addition to the wild west theme. BUT every other point mentioned still stands. it ruins a majority of the game to the point you dont want to play anymore.

These are easy fixes by the way. VERY easy, so im confused why in 4 years ROCKSTAR has never made a damn effort. They should add more plotline / storyline quests, and update some every few months or so, to keep the player interested in playing. There should be unique side missions maybe even unique to the classes added every once in a while too, to keep the grinding for exp fresh and not a chore, and make the game worth buying and playing.

The controls for laptop are bullshit. PC is difficult when you have a lasso, but forget it with a laptop. You cant even pull out your goddamn rope properly. Its difficult to turn and aim and then shoot with a fucking mouse, they should atleast add options for the camera or sensitive on the mouse to fix it.

PVP is so ridiculous. I was a beginer, just loaded into the game after buying it and got headshotted 7 times before I could even take two goddamn steps. They waited at my respawning point. Why isnt there a passive mode, especially for first time players? This is such an insanely easy fix and so annoying to go through, and it doesnt happen once, it has happened many times.

to go on with that, the amount of hackers in this game rival on ridiculous. Ive seen people hack weapons, explosives, and death modes where they cant die and constatnly blow up players or there horses nonstop, it even follows them over changing servers. How are you expecting anyone to buy this game and play it if they cant even take a few steps and try a damn mission without someone ruining it for them?

Then theres the stable glitch. You go in with your horse and get stuck and cannot move. You cannot access your menu or anything. You have no choice but to task manager and end the game that way. Are you kidding me? Why wasnt this tested and run through during beta? Its been four years and you still havent fixed it?
Ive had this glitch happen SIX TIMES IN A ROW. after that i called it a night and shut my damn pc off.

weaponry is so few and basic, why so little options when this game is based on the west? Shooting is part of the whole point to rdr2, yet most weaponry are the same stats and theirs only about eight choices to choose from and their all locked to ridiculous levels, why would i want to spend my time grinding boring delivery missions till i can eventually unlock a weapon at 40 that has no discernible features to any other and has the tiniest differences in stats?

lastly, the horses. The horse options are good but I think more should be added in color and variation. Again the lock grinding is a pain when the missions are so boring, please for the love of God consider fixing rdr2 online.

this game has such potential to be a fantastic MMO but God does it fall short at the moment

Abandoned since 2020-21sh of halloween. This literally got Micro-transactions which are ASTOUNDINGLY expensive once you analyze it. Like thousands of dollars if you pay in gold for everything. 

I would recommend jumping up levels, Gearing up via nefarious means and enjoying CaC simulator since this game was abandoned after they couldnt make it more PVP heavy since ya know, that is the content. Player animosity towards players EXCEPT, This game didnt turn out that way for the most part which is wild once you look at GTA online and its insane hacking problem.

We the players merely wanted a CO OP Cowboy experience we could laugh, Cry, love and enjoy across the board. 

INstead Rockstar took a huge S H I T on our chests and charged us for it. 

0/10 - For greed, lackluster content, actually it got 4 professions and less than 10 story missions.

5.89/10 - Content being modified different online to artifically extend mission time to A: Make the map feel bigger, B: make missions take long and C: same R formula, longer it takes more you get paid.

HOWever if you can look past all of this, The hunting is relaxing, The Fishing and canoes are also lovely.

I just cant recommend a game like this that got abandoned despite players begging for more content. If you do buy it, go find a Gold dropper and dont waste a cent more as Rockstar really does not deserve it for the ONLINE.

Now the MAIN GAME of RDR2 is a delightful Gem and worth full price even today. The online however was a senseless cash grab riddled with hackers who got so bored, most left.

I don't usually write game reviews, but this one is a special case. This will be a long review and to keep organized I decided it into sections.

[b] Gameplay Mechanics:[/b]:

The gameplay mechanics in Red Dead Online are impressive, to say the least. Players can choose to play the game in various modes, including free roam, story missions, and competitive modes. Free roam allows players to explore the world at their own pace, interact with other players, and undertake various challenges and activities such as hunting, fishing, and gathering resources. Story missions offer players a more structured and narrative-driven experience, where they can team up with other players and work together to complete various tasks.

One of the standout features of Red Dead Online is the character customization. Players can create their own characters and customize them to their liking, choosing from various options such as gender, facial features, clothing, and accessories. As players progress through the game, they can earn money and experience points, which can be used to unlock new weapons, abilities, and items. The game also features a robust honor system, where players can gain or lose honor based on their actions in the game. This system can impact the player's interactions with non-player characters and other players.

 [b] Graphics:[/b]:

The graphics in Red Dead Online are breathtaking. The game features a vast and detailed open world, with stunning landscapes, weather effects, and wildlife. The attention to detail in the game is impressive, with every object and character in the world feeling like it belongs. The game also features a day-night cycle, which adds to the immersion and realism of the world. Overall, the graphics in Red Dead Online are top-notch, and they help to create an unforgettable and immersive gaming experience.

 [b] Audio:[/b]:

The audio in Red Dead Online is equally impressive. The game features an original soundtrack that perfectly captures the mood and atmosphere of the Wild West. The sound effects in the game are also excellent, with realistic gunshots, animal noises, and environmental sounds. The voice acting in the game is also top-notch, with convincing performances from all the actors.

 [b] Overall Quality:[/b]:

Red Dead Online is a top-quality game that offers players an unforgettable and immersive experience. The gameplay mechanics are well-designed and offer a range of activities and challenges for players to undertake. The graphics and audio in the game are also top-notch, with stunning visuals and an excellent original soundtrack. The game is regularly updated with new content, and the community is active and engaged, making for a dynamic and exciting online experience.

In conclusion, Red Dead Online is an excellent game that is worth every penny. If you are a fan of the Wild West and enjoy online multiplayer games, then this game is a must-play. It offers players an immersive and unforgettable experience that they will remember for years to come.

As I was walking down the street, I saw a black person walking towards me. My first thought was to cross to the other side of the road. I had grown up in a small, conservative town where people of color were few and far between, and my upbringing had taught me to be suspicious and wary of anyone who looked different from me.

But as I approached the person, I realized that my assumptions and prejudices were unfounded. This person was just like me in many ways - they had a job, a family, and dreams for the future. As we passed each other on the street, I felt a twinge of guilt for my initial reaction. I realized that my narrow-mindedness had been holding me back from seeing the world in a more compassionate and open way.

Seeing that person made me realize that I needed to confront my own biases and start actively working towards being more inclusive and accepting of people from all walks of life. It's not always easy to change the way we think, but it's important to try, and to take steps towards being a better person and a more empathetic member of society. The experience taught me a valuable lesson about the power of empathy and the importance of challenging our own assumptions and prejudices.

Broken game is broken. Support had a ticket open on a game breaking bug since Feb 13 (nearly 3 weeks ago). Have ignored my request to reset my account or try other fixes which could provide workarounds that could at least let me play while they find a dev or tester who isn't death-marching on GTA6. https://www.eurogamer.net/rockstar-confirms-end-of-major-red-dead-online-support

The issue I'm having seems to be related to the stables bug which has been outstanding for months, but has received no real attention. Certainly no fix - just a workaround, which - because I'm stuck in a tutorial sequence - doesn't work.

Not a great experience for someone who has seen what looks like interesting open world game play, but hasn't been able to scratch the surface of this bug. If I launch the game, I cannot exit the quest sequence I'm stuck in. Options to leave are greyed out. I can only close the game via Task Manager. I can't even get back to the entry point to the quest sequence I get stuck in.

This seems like some pretty fundamentally broken game logic. You should always be able to get back to a game's main menu. You should always be able to back out of a quest sequence. This is garbage, and the level of support is no better. Three week's worth of "We can't replicate this" (presumably because they haven't bothered to clone my character onto a test server) and "Your ticket is on hold."

Not good enough.

To be fair, this is a Rockstar game and as such was originally written for hand-held games (I'm on a PC) so the controls are retarded to begin with.

Basic hunting is okay BUT you get ZERO experience to level up-- until you complete the storyline missions.

Right.

Upgrade your weapons? Tried that. No dice. Your starting level isn't high enough to upgrade.

Bring a friend? I did.

Out of the four missions, there is this one requiring multiple firefights on horseback using the .22LR they give you against thugs using pump-action shotguns. They do NOT need to aim, YOU are required to do so.

And....it was no less than fifteen against the two of us.

This isn't a game....this is stupid. And I want a game-- not an ulcer.

I'm done.

P.S. If' you're a Steam or Rockstar fanboi....I really don't want to hear it....because in the end....whatever you have to say I really couldn't care less-- NICEly put.

Oh boy, let me tell y'all about Red Dead Redemption 2, it's like a whole dang bunch of pine-cones and peas mashed up into a video game masterpiece! The mechanics are smoother than a stick of butter on a hot summer day. When you're riding your horse it's like you're flying on a marshmallow cloud and shooting your gun feels like you're throwing a confetti party in the Wild West.

But wait, there's more! The glitches in this game are like tangerines that have been left out in the sun too long and have gone all squishy and gross on the inside. And the storyline? Well, it's about as confusing as trying to eat a pear without peeling it first. But hey, who needs a coherent plot when you can just shoot stuff and ride horses all day?

So if you're looking for a game that's as messy as a pig rolling around in mud, then Red Dead Redemption 2 is the game for you! Yee-haw, partner!

I bought this game as an escape during a time when my dog was incredibly sick & ultimately passed away. It kept me distracted from the intense pain I was going through.

For context: I have been a horse girl for nearly 20 years and I am currently horseless and thus desperate for a good horse game. Those are practically non-existent, so in my time of need I turned to RDO.

The game is gorgeous. The horses are beautiful & the horse mechanics are wonderful. There is something so incredibly satisfying just riding across the vast landscape on the back of your horse. It really is soothing. I spent most of my time simply riding from town to town, murdering and looting the NPC travelers along the way as a form of therapy. It really worked.

The actual game-play itself is dull, repetitive, and marred with the fact that other people exist and will constantly try to ruin your day. I encountered far too many hackers that made it their mission to make game-play impossible for no reason at all. From time to time I would meet a cool group of people who would follow me around and assist me in my adventures, but they were rare. I certainly never felt comfortable enough to ever use the speech chat feature.

So, while the game helped get me through a very rough time in my life and also filled the internal need I have to ride a horse, I cannot recommend it until solo-play or dedicated private servers are a feature. And for those who recommend simply playing RDR2 the solo game... I don't want to play as a man. I want to play as a self-insert. RDO gives me that ability through character creation and that is my favorite feature of the game.

The horses are super pretty though.
